analyzed: puṇḍra ikṣu pāśān kuśa puṣpa vāṇa haste namaḥ te jagat eka mātar
translated: Holding a Puṇḍra mark, a noose, Kuśa grass, and a flower arrow, salutations to you, O mother of the world.

original: iti dhyātvā saṃkṣobhiṇyādimudrāḥ 🔽drāṃ sarvasaṃkṣobhiṇī mudrāṃ pradarśayāmi /

translated: Having meditated thus, the mudrās beginning with Saṃkṣobhinī🔽Drām I display the mudrā of all-agitating.

analyzed: blūṃ sarvavaśankarī mudrām pradarśayāmi

translated: He.🔽KROM I display the great all-purpose Kusha Mudra.🔽HSKHFREM I display the all-pervading Khechari Mudra.

translated: HSOUR I display the all-seed Mudra.🔽AIM I display the all-womb Mudra.

original: hrīṃ rāgātmābhyāṃ kāmeśvara kāmeśvarī pāśamudrāṃ pradarśayāmi /🔽drāṃ drīṃ klīṃ blūṃ saḥ yāṃ rāṃ lāṃ vāṃ śāṃ śabdasparśarūparasagandhātmakābhyāṃ

translated: HREEM I display the noose Mudra of the two selves of passion, Kameshwara and Kameshwari.

analyzed: kāmeśvara kāmeśvarī puṣpa vāṇa mudrām pradarśayāmi
translated: DRAUM DRIM KLIM BLUM SAH YAM RAM LAM VAM SHAM I display the flower arrow Mudra of Kameshwara and Kameshwari, the selves of sound, touch, form, taste, and smell.

original: yaṃ dhaṃ manātmakābhyāṃ kāmeśvara kāmeśvarī ikṣucāpamudrāṃ pradarśayāmi /

analyzed: kirīṭa mudrām pradarśayāmi
translated: I display the crown Mudra.

original: makarakuṇḍalamudrāṃ pradarśayāmi / pañcopacāraiḥ sampūjya sarvaṃ brahma brahmaivāsmi
analyzed: makara kuṇḍala mudrām pradarśayāmi pañca upacāraiḥ sampūjya sarvam brahma brahmā eva asmi
translated: I display the makara earring Mudra. Having worshipped with the five offerings, I am Brahman, Brahman itself.

original: ahamasmi brahma haṃsaḥ sohaṃ śivohaṃ mūlamantraṃ yathāśaktiṃ japitvā japopasaṃhāra kariṣya iti
analyzed: aham asmi brahma haṃsaḥ saḥ aham śivaḥ uham mūlamantram yathāśaktim japitvā japa upasaṃhāra kariṣye iti
translated: I am Brahman, I am the swan, I am Shiva. Having recited the root mantra as much as possible, I shall conclude the recitation, thinking thus.

original: sankalpya punasūryādinyāsaṃ karāngaṃ nyāsaṃ vidhāya dhyātvā mudrā pradarśya
analyzed: san kalpya punar sūrya ādi nyāsam kara angam nyāsam vidhāya dhyātvā mudrā pradarśya
translated: Having made the Nyasa of the sun etc. again, having meditated, having shown the mudra,

original: p / oṃ guhyātiguhyagoptrī tvaṃ gṛhāṇāsmatkṛtaṃ japam /
analyzed: om guhya ati guhya goptrī tvam gṛhāṇa asmad kṛtam japam
translated: Om, you are the protector of the most secret secrets, accept the Japa performed by us.

original: siddhirbhavatu me devi tvatprasādāt tvayi sthitā //
analyzed: siddhiḥ bhavatu me devi tvad prasādāt tvayi sthitā
translated: O Goddess, may I be successful, abiding in you, by your grace.

analyzed: asya śrī siddhavidyā annapūrṇeśvarī mantrasya brahmā ṛṣīḥ yaṣṭi khandaḥ ānnapūrṇeśvarī devatā
translated: Of this Shri Siddhavidya Annapurna Ishvari Mantra, the Rishi is Brahma, the meter is Yashtika, the deity is Annapurna Ishvari.

original: hrīṃ bījaṃ śrīṃ śaktiḥ klīṃ kīlakaṃ mamānnapūrṇeśvarī prasādasiddhyarthe jape viniyogaḥ /

analyzed: ṛṣi ādi nyāsam vidhāya hrām ityādi kara ṣaṣ angam nyāsaḥ

analyzed: dhyāyet devīm siddha vidyām mahā kṣīrārṇave budhaḥ

analyzed: ratna dvīpa lasat svarṇa prākāra bhuvana ujjvale

analyzed: candracūḍa mantra dāna niratām ratna bhūṣitām

analyzed: suvarṇa kalaśa ākāra stana bhāra bhara ujjatām

analyzed: rudra tāṇḍava sa ānandām dvi bhujām parameśvarīm

analyzed: iti dhyātvā darvī sruvam mudre pradarśya mānasaiḥ om hrīṃ śrīṃ klīṃ namaḥ bhagavatī

analyzed: prātar tripurasundaryāḥ namāmi pada pankajam

analyzed: maṇipūra stha viṣṇave ṣaṣ sahasram japam nivedayāmi anāhata stha rudrāya ṣaṣ sahasram japam  nivedayāmi viśuddha cakra stha jīvāya sahasram ekam japam nivedayāmi ājñācakra stha paramātmane
translated: I offer the japa of six thousand to Vishnu residing in the manipura. I offer the japa of one thousand to the supreme self residing in the ajna chakra.

original: sahasramekaṃ japaṃ nivedayāmi / brahmarandhrasthagurave sahasramekaṃ japaṃ nivedayāmi iti nivedya
analyzed: sahasram ekam japam nivedayāmi brahmarandhra stha gurave sahasram ekam japam nivedayāmi iti nivedya
translated: I offer the japa of one thousand to the guru residing in the brahmarandhra. Having offered thus,

translated: I shall perform the Japa of this Ajapajapa, which consists of inhalations and exhalations occurring day and night, totaling twenty-one thousand and six hundred times.

analyzed: saṃkalpya

analyzed: bījam saḥ śaktiḥ saḥ ham kīlakam mama mokṣa arthe jape viniyogaḥ
translated: the power is Sah, the Kilaka is Soham, and the application is for the sake of my liberation in Japa.

original: tato ṛṣyādistattatsthāneṣu yathākramaṃ vinyasya ṣaṭdīrghamāsādabījena karaṣaḍanganyāsaḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣi ādiḥ tad tad sthāneṣu yathākramam vinyasya ṣaṣ dīrgha māsāda bījena kara ṣaṣ anga nyāsaḥ
translated: Then, having assigned the sage and others to their respective places in order, the six-limbed Nyasa of the hands is done with the seed mantra having six long vowels.

translated: The meditation is as follows:🔽I see you, O Swan, abiding in the coming and going, devoid of coming and going, in the form of the light of consciousness, dispelling the darkness of ignorance,

analyzed: iti dhyātvā mānasa upacāraiḥ pūje iyitvā haṃsa gāyatrīm pañcaviṃśati vāram japitvā

analyzed: haṃsaṃhaṃsāya vidmahe paramahaṃsāya dhīmahi tat naḥ haṃsaḥ pracodayāt japam samarpayet

analyzed: tat yathā mūlādhāre catur dale kamale vaṃ śam ṣaṃ saṃ iti varṇa yute tatra sthitāya gaṇapataye

translated: along with the Śākinī Śakti, I offer the recitation of 600 times.

analyzed: svādhiṣṭhāne ṣaṣ dala kamale aṃ bhaṃ maṃ yaṃ raṃ laṃ iti varṇa yute tatra sthitāya brahmaṇe

translated: along with the Kākinī Śakti. To Brahmā, I offer the recitation of 6,000 times.

analyzed: viṣṇave ṣaṣ sahasram japam tubhyam sa
translated: To Viṣṇu, I offer the recitation of 6,000 times.

original: anāhate dvādaśadalakamale kaṃ iti varṇayute tatrasthitāya rudrāya śākinīśaktiyuktāyātra gandha /

translated: In the twelve-petaled lotus at the anāhata, with the syllable Kaṃ, I offer worship with the five offerings of incense, flowers, lamps, and food to Rudra residing there, along with the Śākinī Śakti.

analyzed: rudrāya ṣaṣ sahasra japam tubhyam sa
translated: To Rudra, I offer the recitation of 6,000 times.

original: viśuddhau ṣoḍaśadalakamale aṃ iti varṇayute tatra sthitāya jīvāya ḍākinīśaktiyuktāyātra /
analyzed: viśuddhau ṣoḍaśa dala kamale aṃ iti varṇa yute tatra sthitāya jīvāya ḍākinī śakti yuktāya atra gandha
translated: In the sixteen-petaled lotus of purity, endowed with the syllable am, to the individual soul residing there, endowed with the power of the Dakini, here.

analyzed: jīvāya sahasram eka japam tubhyam sa
translated: To the individual soul, I offer one thousand recitations to you.

original: aājñāyāṃ dvidalakamale haṃ kṣaṃ iti varṇayute tatra sthitāya paramātmane hākinīśaktiyuktāyātra
analyzed: a ājñāyām dvidala kamale haṃ   iti varṇa yute tatra sthitāya paramātmane hākinī śakti yuktāya atra
translated: In the forehead, in the two-petaled lotus, endowed with the syllables ham ksha, to the supreme self residing there, endowed with the power of the Hakini, here.

analyzed: gandha paramātmane sahasram ekam japam tubhyam sa
translated: To the supreme self, I offer one thousand recitations to you.

translated: On the tips of the left fingers, ञ with salutations. At the base of the right thigh, ट with salutations.🔽On the right knee, ठ with salutations. On the right ankle, ड with salutations.

analyzed: dakṣa pāda anguli mūle ḍhaṃ namaḥ dakṣa pāda anguli agreṣu ṇaṃ namaḥ
translated: At the base of the right toes, ढ with salutations. On the tips of the right toes, ण with salutations.

analyzed: daśa pārśve paṃ namaḥ

original: vāmapārśve phaṃ namaḥ / pṛṣṭhe baṃ namaḥ / nābhau bhaṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: vāma pārśve phaṃ namaḥ pṛṣṭhe baṃ namaḥ nābhau bhaṃ namaḥ

analyzed: jaṭhare maṃ namaḥ
translated: In the belly, maṃ namaḥ.

analyzed: hṛdayāt upari kaṇṭha antam m upari upari nyaset
translated: One should place above the heart up to the throat

original: yaṃ namaḥ / raṃ namaḥ / laṃ namaḥ / vaṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: yaṃ namaḥ raṃ namaḥ laṃ namaḥ vaṃ namaḥ
translated: yaṃ namaḥ, raṃ namaḥ, laṃ namaḥ, vaṃ namaḥ,

original: śaṃ namaḥ / p / ṣaṃ namaḥ / saṃ namaḥ / haṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: śam namaḥ p ṣaṃ namaḥ sam namaḥ haṃ namaḥ
translated: śaṃ namaḥ, ṣaṃ namaḥ, saṃ namaḥ, haṃ namaḥ,

original: laṃ namaḥ / kṣaṃ namaḥ / iti vargādidaśadhātubījāni nyaset / iti bahirmātṛkānyāsaḥ /
analyzed: laṃ namaḥ kṣaṃ namaḥ iti varga ādi daśa dhātu bījāni nyaset iti bahis mātṛkā nyāsaḥ
translated: laṃ namaḥ, kṣaṃ namaḥ. Thus one should place the seed syllables of the ten elements beginning with the group. This is the external Mātṛkā Nyāsa.

original: evaṃ dhyātvā nyaset paścā dvidhā nyāsaṃ sureśvarī tato bālādyāṃ mūlādyāṃ
analyzed: evam dhyātvā nyaset paścā dvidhā nyāsam sureśvarī tatas bāla ādyām mūla ādyām
translated: Having meditated thus, one should perform the Nyāsa in two ways, O Goddess of Suras, then having created the creation beginning with the child, beginning with the root,

analyzed: kāma ādyām ramā ādyām sṛṣṭim vidhāya nyaset
translated: beginning with Kāma, beginning with Ramā, one should perform the Nyāsa.

original: oṃ aiṃ klīṃ sauṃ aṃ namaḥ keśāntamityādi / mūlaṃ aṃ namaḥ keśāntamityādi / hrīṃ a namaḥ
analyzed: om aim   sauṃ aṃ namaḥ keśāntam ityādi mūlam aṃ namaḥ keśāntam ityādi hrīṃ a namaḥ
translated: Om Aim Klim Sauṃ Aṃ Namaḥ. The root is Aṃ Namaḥ. Hriṃ A Namaḥ.

original: klīṃ aṃ namaḥ śrīṃ aṃ namaḥ aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ madhyamāditalāntam /
analyzed: klīṃ aṃ namaḥ śrīṃ aṃ namaḥ aim hrīṃ śrīṃ madhyama ādi tala antam
translated: Klim A Namaḥ. Śrīṃ A Namaḥ. Aim Hriṃ Śrīṃ from the middle finger to the tip of the finger.

original: dvirāvṛtyā anguliṣu karaśuddhiḥ / anyonya sparśanādvāmadakṣakaratalakara pṛṣṭhayoḥ /
analyzed: dvis āvṛtyā anguliṣu kara śuddhiḥ anyonya sparśanāt vāma dakṣa kara tala kara pṛṣṭhayoḥ
translated: By repeating twice, there is purification of the fingers. By mutual contact of the left and right palm and back of the hand,
The Vidya that purifies the hands, from the middle to the end of the palm,

analyzed: angulīṣu dvis āvṛtyā kara śuddhiḥ iyam priye
translated: By repeating twice on the fingers, this is the purification of the hands, O beloved.

original: oṃ tatrādau keśavādimātṛkānyāsaḥ / tatra sādhyanārāyaṇa ṛṣiḥ gāyatrīchandaḥ

translated: Om. First, the Nyasa of the Matrikas beginning with Keshava. There, the Rishi is Sadhyanarayana, the meter is Gayatri,

original: śrīlakṣmīnārāyaṇo devatā mama śrīvidyāngatvena nyāse viniyogaḥ iti ṛṣyādikaṃ smṛtvā vinyasya

translated: The deity is Shri Lakshminarayana. I am engaged in the Nyasa of the limbs of Shri Vidya. Remembering the Rishi and other details, one should perform the Nyasa.

original: karānganyāsaṃ kuryāt / tadyathā oṃ śrī oṃ namo nārāyaṇāya p / haṃsaḥ sohaṃ aṃ kaṃ

original: khaṃ gaṃ ghaṃ ṅaṃ āṃ hrīṃ haṃsaḥ sohaṃ oṃ namo nārāyaṇāya ddholkāya svāhā śrīdevyai

original: hṛdayāya namaḥ / oṃ śrīṃ oṃ namo nārāyaṇāya haṃsaḥ sohaṃ iṃ caṃ chaṃ jaṃ jhaṃ ñaṃ īṃ

translated: The lotus of knowledge, the mirror, the pot of nectar, the lotus, the Kaumodaki mace, and the beautiful Sudarshana discus adorn your hands.

analyzed: evam praṇava tri tāra ādi tri bīja sampuṭam ca sarvatra
translated: Thus, everywhere, the three seed syllables beginning with Pranava and Tara are enclosed.

analyzed: ūm madhusūdanāya śāntyai namaḥ vāma karṇe

analyzed: aum san karṣaṇāya sarasvatyai namaḥ adhas danta panktau

analyzed: aṃ pradyumnāya prītyai namaḥ mastake

analyzed: aḥ aniruddhāya ratyai namaḥ grīvāyām

analyzed: kaṃ cakriṇe jayāyai namaḥ

analyzed: khaṃ gadine durgāyai namaḥ

analyzed: gaṃ śārngiṇe prabhāyai namaḥ
translated: Gam, salutations to the wielder of the Sharnga bow for Prabha.

original: ghaṃ khaḍgine satyāyai namaḥ /🔽ṅaṃ śankhiṇe caṇḍāyai namaḥ dakṣabāhumūlasandhyagreṣu /

translated: Ch. Salutations to Musalini, the playful one.🔽Ja. Salutations to Shulin, the victorious one.

translated: Tha. Salutations to Krishna, the intelligent one.🔽Da. Salutations to Satya, the prosperous one.

analyzed: dhaṃ sātvatāya matyai namaḥ

translated: Pa. Salutations to Shura, the supreme one, on the right side.

analyzed: phaṃ janārdanāya umāyai namaḥ vāma pārśve
translated: Pha. Salutations to Janardana, to Uma, on the left side.

original: baṃ bhūdharāya kledinyai namaḥ pṛṣṭhe /🔽bhaṃ viśvamūttaye klinnāyai namaḥ nābhau /
analyzed: baṃ bhūdharāya kledinyai namaḥ pṛṣṭhe  bhaṃ viśvamūttaye klinnāyai namaḥ nābhau
translated: Ba. Salutations to Bhughara, the moistening one, on the back.🔽Bha. Salutations to Vishva-muttaya, the moist one, on the navel.

analyzed: maṃ vaikuṇṭhāya vasudhāyai namaḥ udare
translated: Ma. Salutations to Vaikuntha, to Vasudha, on the belly.

original: yaṃ tvagātmane puruṣottamāya vasudāyai namaḥ hṛdi /🔽raṃ asṛgātmane baline parāyai namaḥ dakṣāṃse /
analyzed: yam tvac ātmane puruṣottamāya vasudāyai namaḥ hṛdi  raṃ asṛj ātmane baline parāyai namaḥ dakṣa aṃse
translated: To the supreme person, the giver of wealth, I offer salutations in the heart.🔽 To the strong one, the soul of blood, to the supreme one, I offer salutations in the right shoulder.

original: laṃ māsātmane balānujāya parāyaṇāyai namaḥ kakudi /🔽vaṃ medātmane valāya sūkṣmāyai namaḥ vāmāṃse /🔽śaṃ asthyātmane vṛṣaghnāya sandhyāyai namaḥ hṛdādidakṣakare /
analyzed: vaṃ medā ātmane valāya sūkṣmāyai namaḥ vāma aṃse  śam asthi ātmane vṛṣa ghnāya sandhyāyai namaḥ hṛd ādi dakṣa kare
translated: To the powerful one, the soul of flesh, to the younger brother of strength, to the supreme refuge, I offer salutations in the topknot.🔽 To the subtle one, the soul of fat, to strength, to the supreme one, I offer salutations in the left shoulder.🔽 To the destroyer of Vṛṣa, the soul of bones, to the twilight, I offer salutations in the right hand beginning from the heart.

original: ṣaṃ majjātmane vṛṣāya prajñāyai namaḥ hṛdādivāmakare /🔽saṃ śuklātmane haṃsāya prabhāyai namaḥ hṛdādidakṣapāde /🔽haṃ prāṇātmane varāhāya niśāyai namaḥ hṛdādivāmapāde /
analyzed: ṣaṃ majja ātmane vṛṣāya prajñāyai namaḥ hṛd ādi vāma kare  saṃ śukla ātmane haṃsāya prabhāyai namaḥ hṛd ādi dakṣa pāde  haṃ prāṇa ātmane varāhāya niśāyai namaḥ hṛd ādi vāma pāde
translated: To the bull, the soul of marrow, to wisdom, I offer salutations in the left hand beginning from the heart.🔽 To the swan, the soul of whiteness, to the light, I offer salutations in the right foot beginning from the heart.🔽 To the boar, the soul of life, to the night, I offer salutations in the left foot beginning from the heart.

original: p / laṃ śaktyātmane vimalāya ādhārāyai namaḥ hṛdādyudare /
translated: To the pure one, the soul of power, to the foundation, I offer salutations in the belly beginning from the heart.

original: oṃ aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ klīṃ kṣaṃ klīṃ śrīṃ hrīṃ paramātmane nṛsiṃhāya vidyutāyai namaḥ
analyzed: om aim hrīṃ śrīṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ klīṃ kṣaṃ klīṃ śrīṃ hrīṃ paramātmane nṛsiṃhāya vidyutāyai namaḥ
translated: Om, Aim, Hrim, Shrim, Hrim, Shrim, Klim, Ksham, Klim, Shrim, Hrim, to the supreme soul, to Nṛsiṃha, to lightning, I offer salutations.

analyzed: hṛd ādi mukhe etāḥ mūrti śaktayaḥ mātṛkā sthāneṣu nyastavyāḥ
translated: These are the energies of the forms, to be placed in the locations of the Mātṛkā.

analyzed: keśava ādyāḥ ime śyāmāḥ
translated: These Keśava and others are dark, with shining conch and discus in their hands.

analyzed: rakta priyān keṣu niṣaṇṇāḥ vismita ānanāḥ
translated: The Shaktis, fond of blood, are seated in the nails, with astonished faces.

analyzed: vidyut dāma samānāgyaḥ pankajāḥ bhaya bāhavaḥ
translated: The Vidhyadharas, with the speed of lightning, have lotus-like arms.

analyzed: iti dhyātvā iti keśava ādi mātṛkā nyāsaḥ
translated: Having meditated thus, this is the Nyasa of the Mātṛkās beginning with Keśava.

original: atha śrīkaṇṭhādimātṛkānyāsaḥ / tatra dakṣiṇāmūrti ṛṣiḥ gāyatrī chandaḥ śrīardhanārīśvaro devatā
analyzed: atha śrīkaṇṭha ādi mātṛkā nyāsaḥ tatra dakṣiṇāmūrti ṛṣiḥ gāyatrī chandaḥ śrī ardhanārīśvaraḥ devatā
translated: Now, the Nyasa of the Mātṛkās beginning with Śrīkaṇṭha. There, the sage is Dakṣiṇāmūrti, the meter is Gāyatrī, and Śrī Ardhanārīśvara is the deity.
The application is in the Nyāsa for the sake of the Śrīvidyā limbs.

original: iti ṛṣyādi smṛtvā vinyasya oṃ aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ aṃ kaṃ khaṃ gaṃ ghaṃ ṅaṃ āṃ hsāṃ hṛdayāya
analyzed: iti ṛṣi ādi smṛtvā vinyasya om aim   śrīṃ aṃ kaṃ khaṃ gaṃ ghaṃ ṅaṃ āṃ   hṛdayāya
translated: Having remembered thus, the sage etc., one should place the Nyāsa. Om Aim Hrīm Śrīm. Aṃ Kaṃ Khaṃ Gaṃ Ghaṃ Ṅaṃ Āṃ Hṣāṃ to the heart,

analyzed: namaḥ
translated: Salutations.

original: iṃ caṃ chaṃ jaṃ jhaṃ ñaṃ īṃ hsīṃ śirase svāhā /
analyzed: iṃ caṃ chaṃ jaṃ jhaṃ ñaṃ īṃ   śirase svāhā
translated: Iṃ Caṃ Chaṃ Jaṃ Jhaṃ Ṇaṃ Īṃ Hṣīṃ to the head, Svāhā.

original: uṃ ṭaṃ ṭhaṃ ḍaṃ ḍhaṃ ṇaṃ ūṃ hsuṃ śikhāyai vaṣaṭ /
analyzed: um ṭaṃ ṭhaṃ ḍaṃ ḍhaṃ naṃ ūm hsuṃ śikhāyai vaṣaṭ
translated: Uṃ Ṭaṃ Ṭhaṃ Ḍaṃ Ḍhaṃ Ṇaṃ Ūṃ Hṣuṃ to the tuft, Vaṣaṭ.

original: eṃ taṃ thaṃ daṃ dhaṃ naṃ aiṃ hsaiṃ kavacāya huṃ /
analyzed: eṃ taṃ thaṃ daṃ dhaṃ naṃ aim   kavacāya hum
translated: Aiṃ Taṃ Thaṃ Daṃ Dhaṃ Naṃ Aiṃ Hṣaiṃ to the armor, Huṃ.

original: oṃ paṃ phaṃ baṃ bhaṃ maṃ auṃ hsauṃ netratrayāya vauṣaṭ /
analyzed: om paṃ phaṃ baṃ bhaṃ maṃ aum   netratrayāya vauṣaṭ
translated: Oṃ Paṃ Phaṃ Baṃ Bhaṃ Maṃ Auṃ Hṣauṃ to the three eyes, Vaṣaṭ.

original: aṃ yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ śaṃ ṣaṃ saṃ haṃ laṃ kṣaṃ aḥ hasḥ astrāya phaṭ / iti karaṣaḍangeṣu
analyzed: aṃ yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ śam ṣaṃ saṃ haṃ laṃ   aḥ hasḥ astrāya phaṭ iti kara ṣaṣ angeṣu
translated: Aṃ Yaṃ Raṃ Laṃ Vaṃ Śaṃ Ṣaṃ Saṃ Haṃ Laṃ Kṣaṃ Aḥ Hṣaḥ to the weapon, Phaṭ. Having placed the Nyāsa on the six limbs of the hands,

analyzed: vinyasya
translated: one should bind.

analyzed: bandhūka kāñcana nibham rucira akṣamālām
translated: The one resembling the color of a bandhuka flower, with a beautiful rosary,

analyzed: pāśān kuśau ca vara dam nija bāhu daṇḍaiḥ
translated: Holding nooses, a goad, and a boon-granting gesture with his own arms,

analyzed: vibhrāṇam indu śakala ābharaṇam trinetram
translated: Adorned with a crescent moon, with three eyes,

analyzed: ardha ambikeśam aniśam vapuḥ āśrayāmaḥ
translated: With half of Ambika's hair, we always take refuge in that form.

original: p / dakṣādhaḥ karamārabhya dakṣordhvakaraparyantaṃ āyudhadhyānam / nyaset 🔽oṃ aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ hsauṃ aṃ śrīkaṇṭheśāya pūrṇodaryai namaḥ lālāṭe /
analyzed: dakṣa adhas karam ārabhya dakṣa ūrdhva kara paryantam āyudha dhyānam nyaset  om aim   śrīṃ   aṃ śrīkaṇṭha īśāya pūrṇa udaryai namaḥ lālāṭe
translated: The meditation on the weapons should be placed from the lower right hand up to the upper right hand.🔽Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsaum. Salutations to Shri Kantha Ishvara and Purnodari in the forehead.

original: hsauṃ āṃ ananteśāya virajāyai namaḥ mukhe / evaṃ🔽hsauṃḥ iṃ sūkṣmeśāya śālmalyai namaḥ dakṣanetre /
analyzed: hsauṃ āṃ ananta īśāya virajāyai namaḥ mukhe evam  hsauṃḥ iṃ sūkṣmeśāya śālmalyai namaḥ dakṣa netre
translated: Hsaum Aam. Salutations to Ananta Ishvara and Viraja in the mouth.🔽In the same way,🔽Hsaum Im. Salutations to Sukshma Ishvara and Shalmalya in the right eye.

original: hsauṃ īṃ trimūrtīśāya lolākṣyai namaḥ vāmanetre /🔽hsauṃ uṃ amareśāya vartulākṣyai namaḥ dakṣakarṇe /
analyzed: hsauṃ īṃ trimūrti īśāya lola akṣyai namaḥ vāmanetre  hsauṃ um amareśāya vartula akṣyai namaḥ dakṣa karṇe
translated: Hsaum Eem. Salutations to Trimurti Ishvara and Lolakshi in the left eye.🔽Hsaum Uum. Salutations to Amara Ishvara and Vartulakshi in the right ear.

original: hsauṃ ūṃ arghīśāya dīrghaghoṇāyai namaḥ vāmakarṇe /
analyzed: hsauṃ ūm arghīśāya dīrghaghoṇāyai namaḥ vāma karṇe
translated: Hsaum Uum. Salutations to Arghi Ishvara and Dirghaghona in the left ear.

original: hsauṃ ṛṃ bharabhūtīśāya sudīrghamukhyai namaḥ dakṣanāsāpuṭe /🔽hsauṃ ṝṃ atithīśāya gomukhyai namaḥ vāmanāsāpuṭe /
analyzed: ṛṃ bharabhūti īśāya su dīrgha mukhyai namaḥ dakṣa nāsāpuṭe  hsauṃ ṝṃ atithi īśāya gomukhyai namaḥ vāma nāsāpuṭe
translated: Hsaum Rrim. Salutations to Bharabhuti Ishvara and Sudirghamuhi in the right nostril.🔽Hsaum Rrim. Salutations to Atithi Ishvara and Gomuhi in the left nostril.

original: hsauṃ ḷṃ sthāṇvīśāya dīrghajihvāyai namaḥ dakṣagaṇḍe /
analyzed: hsauṃ ḷṃ sthāṇvī īśāya dīrghajihvāyai namaḥ dakṣa gaṇḍe
translated: Hsaum Laam. Salutations to Sthanvi Ishvara and Dirghajihva in the right cheek.

original: hsauṃ ḹṃ hareśāya kuṇḍodaryai namaḥ vāmagaṇḍe /
analyzed: ḹṃ hareśāya kuṇḍodaryai namaḥ vāma gaṇḍe
translated: Hsaum ॡं salutations to Hariśā, Kundodari, on the left cheek.

original: hsauṃ eṃ jhaṇṭīśāya ūrdhvakeśyai namaḥ ūrdhvoṣṭhe /
analyzed: hsauṃ eṃ jhaṇṭīśāya ūrdhva keśyai namaḥ ūrdhva oṣṭhe
translated: Hsaum Eṃ salutations to Jhaṇṭīśa, Ūrdhvakeśī, on the upper lip.

original: hsauṃ aiṃ bhautikeśāya vikṛtamukhyai namaḥ adharoṣṭhe /🔽hsauṃ oṃ sadyojāteśāya jvālāmukhyai namaḥ ūrdhvadantapanktau /
analyzed: hsauṃ aim bhautikeśāya vikṛta mukhyai namaḥ adhara uṣṭhe  hsauṃ om sadyojāta īśāya jvālāmukhyai namaḥ ūrdhva danta panktau
translated: Hsaum Aiṃ salutations to Bhautikeśa, Vikṛtamukhī, on the lower lip.🔽Hsaum Oṃ salutations to Sadyojāteśa, Jvālāmukhī, on the upper row of teeth.

original: hsauṃ auṃ anugraheśāya ulkāmukhyai namaḥ adhodantapanktau /
analyzed: hsauṃ aum anugraha īśāya ulkāmukhyai namaḥ adhas danta panktau
translated: Hsaum Auṃ salutations to Anugrahīśa, Ulkāmukhī, on the lower row of teeth.

original: hsauṃ aṃ akrūreśāya śrīmukhyai namaḥ mastake /
analyzed: hsauṃ aṃ akrūra īśāya śrīmukhyai namaḥ mastake
translated: Hsaum Aṃ salutations to Akrūreśa, Śrīmukhi, on the head.

original: hsauṃ aḥ mahāseneśāya vidyāmukhyai namaḥ grīvāyām /
analyzed: hsauṃ aḥ mahāsena īśāya vidyāmukhyai namaḥ grīvāyām
translated: Hsaum Aḥ salutations to Mahāseneśa, Vidyāmukhī, on the neck.

analyzed: hsauṃ kaṃ krodhīśāya mahākālyai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Kaṃ salutations to Krodhīśa, Mahākālī,

analyzed: hsauṃ khaṃ caṇḍeśāya sarasvatyai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Khaṃ salutations to Caṇḍeśa, Sarasvatī,

analyzed: gaṃ pañcāntaka īśāya sarva siddhi gauryai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Gaṃ salutations to Pañcāntakeśa, Sarvasiddhi-Gaurī,

analyzed: hsauṃ ghaṃ śiva uttama īśāya trailokya vidhāyai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Ghaṃ salutations to Śivottara-Īśa, Trailokya-Vidhāyinī,

original: hsauṃ ṅaṃ ekarudreśāya mantraśaktyai namaḥ dakṣabhujamūlasandhyagreṣu /
analyzed: hsauṃ ṅaṃ eka rudra īśāya mantra śaktyai namaḥ dakṣa bhuja mūla sandhi agreṣu
translated: Hsaum Ṅaṃ salutations to Ekarudra-Īśa, Mantra-Śakti, on the root, joints, and tips of the right arm.

original: p / hsauṃ ca kūrmaśāya ātmaśaktyai namaḥ
analyzed: ca kūrma śāye ātma śaktyai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Caṃ salutations to Kūrma-Śā, Ātma-Śakti,

analyzed: hsauṃ chaṃ ekanetra īśāya bhūtamātre namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Chaṃ salutations to Ekanetra-Īśa, Bhūta-Mātṛ,

analyzed: hsauṃ jaṃ caturānana īśāya lambodaryai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Jam to the Lord of the Four Faces, to the One with a Hanging Belly, salutations.

original: hsauṃ jhaṃ ajeśāya drāviṇyai namaḥ🔽hsauṃ ñaṃ sarveśāya nāgaryai namaḥ vāmabhujamūlasandhyagreṣu /🔽hsauṃ ṭaṃ someśāya khecaryai namaḥ
analyzed: hsauṃ jhaṃ aja īśāya drāviṇyai namaḥ  hsauṃ ñaṃ sarveśāya nāgaryai namaḥ vāma bhujamūla sandhi agreṣu  hsauṃ ṭaṃ someśāya khecaryai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Jham to the Lord of Goats, to the One who Drags, salutations.🔽Hsaum Njam to the Lord of All, to the One from the City, salutations at the tips of the joints of the root and middle of the left arm.🔽Hsaum Tjam to the Lord of Soma, to the Sky-goer, salutations.

analyzed: hsauṃ ṭhaṃ lāngalīśāya mañjaryai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Thjam to the Lord of the Plough, to the Cluster, salutations.

original: hsauṃ ḍaṃ rudrakeśāyarūpiṇyai namaḥ🔽hsauṃ ḍhaṃ ardhanārīśvarāya vīriṇyai namaḥ
analyzed: hsauṃ ḍaṃ namaḥ  hsauṃ ḍhaṃ ardhanārīśvarāya vīriṇyai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Djam to the One in the Form of Rudra's Hair, salutations.🔽Hsaum Dham to the Lord of Half a Woman, to the One with a Womb, salutations.

original: hsauṃ ṇaṃ umākānteśāya kākodaryai namaḥ dakṣapādamūlasandhyagreṣu /🔽hsauṃ taṃ āṣāḍhīśāya pūtanāyai namaḥ
analyzed: hsauṃ ṇaṃ umā kānta īśāya kākodaryai namaḥ dakṣa pāda mūla sandhi agreṣu  hsauṃ taṃ āṣāḍhīśāya pūtanāyai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Njam to the Lord of Uma's Beloved, to the One with a Crow's Belly, salutations at the tips of the joints of the root and middle of the right foot.🔽Hsaum Tam to the Lord of Ashadha, to the Purifier, salutations.

analyzed: hsauṃ thaṃ daṇḍīśāya bhadrakālyai namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Tham to the Lord with a Staff, to the Auspicious Black One, salutations.

original: hsauṃ daṃ atrīśāya yoginyai namaḥ🔽hsauṃ dhaṃ mīneśāya śankhinyaiḥ namaḥ
analyzed: hsauṃ daṃ atri īśāya yoginyai namaḥ    dhaṃ mīneśāya śankhinyaiḥ namaḥ
translated: Hsaum Dam to the Lord of Atri, to the Yogin, salutations.🔽Hsaum Dham to the Lord of the Fish, to the Conch-bearer, salutations.

original: hsauṃ naṃ meṣeśāya garjinyai namaḥ vāmapādamūlasandhyagreṣu /🔽hsauṃ paṃ lohiteśāya kālarātryai namaḥ dakṣapārśve /
analyzed: hsauṃ naṃ meṣa īśāya garjinyai namaḥ vāma pāda mūla sandhi agreṣu  hsauṃ paṃ lohiteśāya kālarātryai namaḥ dakṣa pārśve
translated: Hsaum Njam to the Lord of the Ram, to the Roaring One, salutations at the tips of the joints of the root and middle of the left foot.🔽Hsaum Pam to the Lord of Blood, to the Black Night, salutations on the right side.

original: hsauṃ phaṃ śikhīśāya kubjinyai namaḥ vāmapārśve /
translated: Hsaum Pham to the Lord of the Crest, to the Hunchback, salutations on the left side.

original: hsauṃ baṃ chagalaṇḍeśāya kapardinyai namaḥ pṛṣṭhe /
analyzed: hsauṃ baṃ chagalaṇḍā īśāya kapardinyai namaḥ pṛṣṭhe
translated: Hsaum Bam to the Lord of Chagalanda, to Kapardini, salutations on the back.

original: hsauṃ bhaṃ dviraṇḍeśāya vajrāyai namaḥ nābhau /
analyzed: hsauṃ bhaṃ dviraṇḍa īśāya vajrāyai namaḥ nābhau
translated: Hsaum Bham to the Lord of Dviranda, to Vajra, salutations on the navel.

original: hsauṃ maṃ mahākāleśāya jayāyai namaḥ udare /
analyzed: hsauṃ maṃ mahākāla īśāya jayāyai namaḥ udare
translated: Hsaum Mam to the Lord of Mahakala, to Jaya, salutations on the belly.

original: hsauṃ yaṃ tvagātmane bālīśāya sumukhyai namaḥ hṛdi /
analyzed: hsauṃ yaṃ tvac ātmane bālīśāya sumukhyai namaḥ hṛdi
translated: Hsaum Yam to the skin-soul, to Balisha, to Sumukhi, salutations on the heart.

original: hsauṃ raṃ asṛgātmane bhujangeśāya revatyai namaḥ dakṣāṃse /
analyzed: hsauṃ raṃ asṛj ātmane bhujanga īśāya revatyai namaḥ dakṣa aṃse
translated: Hsaum Ram to the blood-soul, to Bhujangisha, to Revati, salutations on the right shoulder.

original: hsauṃ laṃ māṃsātmane pinākīśāya mādhavyai namaḥ kakudi /
analyzed: hsauṃ laṃ māṃsa ātmane pinākīśāya mādhavyai namaḥ kakudi
translated: Hsaum Lam to the flesh-soul, to Pinaki, to Madhavi, salutations on the top of the head.

original: hsauṃ vaṃ medātmane khaḍgīśāya vāruṇyai namaḥ vāmāṃse /🔽hsauṃ śaṃ asthyātmane bakeśāya vāyavyai namaḥ hṛdādidakṣakare /
analyzed: hsauṃ vaṃ medā ātmane khaḍgīśāya vāruṇyai namaḥ vāma aṃse  hsauṃ śam asthi ātmane baka īśāya vāyavyai namaḥ hṛd ādi dakṣa kare
translated: Hsaum Wam to the fat-soul, to Khadgisha, to Varuni, salutations on the left shoulder.🔽Hsaum Sham to the bone-soul, to Bakisha, to Vayavya, salutations on the right hand beginning from the heart.

original: hsauṃ ṣaṃ majjātmane śveteśāya rakṣo vidāriṇyai namaḥ hṛdādivāmakare /
analyzed: hsauṃ ṣaṃ majja ātmane śveta īśāya rakṣaḥ vidāriṇyai namaḥ hṛd ādi vāma kare
translated: Hsaum Sham to the marrow-soul, to Shvetisha, to Rakshas Vidarini, salutations on the left hand beginning from the heart.

original: hsauṃ saṃ bhuktātmane bhṛgvīśāya sahajāyai namaḥ hṛdādidakṣapāde /
analyzed: hsauṃ saṃ bhukta ātmane bhṛgvīśāya sahajāyai namaḥ hṛd ādi dakṣa pāde
translated: Hsaum Sam to the enjoyed-soul, to Bhrigisha, to Sahaja, salutations on the right foot beginning from the heart.

original: hsauṃ haṃ prāṇātmane nakulīśāya mahālakṣmyai namaḥ🔽hṛdādivāmapāde /

analyzed: bheruṇḍā pātu me kaṇṭhe totalā sthātu mastake
translated: May Bherunda protect my throat, and Totala remain on my head.

original: tathā subalarekhāpi mūle sthātu sadā mama // //
analyzed: tathā subalarekhā api mūle sthātu sadā mama  /
translated: Similarly, Subalarekha should always remain at the root of my body.

analyzed: jāṅgalī viṣa nāśāya vācā siddhim karotu me
translated: May Jangali bring about the destruction of poison and the accomplishment of speech for me.
The Vidya that grants all accomplishments, that bestows the fruits of enjoyment and liberation.

original: lalāṭe maṅgalā sthātu vijayā sthātu mastake /
analyzed: lalāṭe maṅgalā sthātu vijayā sthātu mastake
translated: May Mangala remain on my forehead, and Vijaya on my head.

analyzed: eka akṣī dakṣiṇa skandhe vāme ca eva tri locanā  /
translated: May Ekaksi remain on the right shoulder, and Trilocana on the left.

original: jayantī sthātu me kukṣau kaṭyāṃ kandarpamohinī /
analyzed: jayantī sthātu me kukṣau kaṭyām kandarpa mohinī
translated: May Jayanti remain in my belly, and Kandarpa-mohinI in my waist.

original: mālinī liṅgasandhau ca hṛdi sthātu samādhinī // //
analyzed: mālinī liṅga sandhau ca hṛdi sthātu samādhinī
translated: May Malini remain at the junction of the genitals, and SamadhinI in the heart.

original: ambikā pṛṣṭhavaṃśe ca pārśvayo sthātu medinī /🔽diggajāṅgī karāgreṣu nāgendrī nakhasandhiṣu // //
analyzed: ambikā pṛṣṭhavaṃśe ca pārśvayoḥ sthātu medinī  diggajāṅgī kara agreṣu nāgendrī nakha sandhiṣu
translated: May Ambika remain in the spine, and Medini on my sides.🔽May Diggaja's limbs remain on my fingertips, and Nagendri on the joints of my nails.

original: vyāghrī cakrī ca jaṅghāyāṃ sthātu pādatale mahī /🔽amṛtā śaṅkhinī randhre locane ca vilāsinī // //
analyzed: vyāghrī cakrī ca jaṅghāyām sthātu pāda tale mahī  amṛtā śaṅkhinī randhre locane ca vilāsinī  /
translated: May Vyaghi and Chakra remain in the calves, and Mahi on the soles of my feet.🔽May Amrita and Shankhini remain in the cavities, and Vilasini in the eyes.

original: kālindī mūlajihvā ca raktaṃ rakṣatu raktinī /
analyzed: kālindī mūlajihvā ca raktam rakṣatu raktinī
translated: May Kalindi protect the root of the tongue, and Rakta protect the blood.

analyzed: lāṅgalī jāṅgulam rakṣet asthinī ca asthi sandhiṣu
translated: Let Langali protect the joints, and Asthini the bones and their joints.

original: majjinī dehamajjāṃ ca śukraṃ śukreśvarī tathā /
analyzed: majjinī deha majjām ca śukram śukreśvarī tathā
translated: Let Majjini protect the marrow of the body, and Shukresvari the semen.

original: p / tvacaṃ rakṣatu vetālī mama rogapranāśinī // //
analyzed: tvacam rakṣatu vetālī mama roga pranāśinī  /
translated: Let Vetalini, the destroyer of my diseases, protect the skin.

original: udbhaṭā kurutāṃ śāntiṃ sadaiva mama vigrahe /
analyzed: udbhaṭā kurutām śāntim sadā eva mama vigrahe
translated: Let Udbhata always bring peace to my body.

analyzed: padmā pāda tale sthātu pathi rakṣatu panthinī  /
translated: Let Pathini protect me on the path, standing at the soles of the lotus feet.

analyzed: cora agni rāja sarpebhyaḥ bhayāt rakṣatu bhairavī
translated: Let Bhairavi protect me from the fear of thieves, fire, kings, and serpents.

original: duṣṭānāṃ dṛṣṭibandhaṃ ca sadā karotu bandhinī // //
analyzed: duṣṭānām dṛṣṭi bandham ca sadā karotu bandhinī
translated: Let Bandhini always bind the sight of the wicked.

original: capeṭā nāma yā vidyā sā me karotu maṅgalām /
analyzed: capeṭā nāma yā vidyā sā me karotu maṅgalām
translated: Let the Vidya named Chapeta bring me auspiciousness.

original: markaṭī ghaṭakarṇā ca hanumantī ca rāvaṇī // //🔽ghurghurīti ca vikhyātā vande vidyācatuṣṭayam /
analyzed: markaṭī ghaṭakarṇā ca hanumantī ca rāvaṇī  ghurghurī iti ca vikhyātā vande vidyā catuṣṭayam
translated: I bow to the set of four Vidyas known as Markati, Ghatakarni, Hanumanti, and Ravani.
Let the servant Vidya, the bestower of knowledge, and the row of feet of Kumari,

analyzed: vighna rājaiḥ sutā nāma tuṣṭā santāna rūpiṇī
translated: The daughter named Tushtasantanarupini, the queen of obstacles,
The goose residing in the primordial space, the remover of the leaves of sinners,

analyzed: daśa etāḥ mantra vidyāḥ tu tiṣṭhantu mama mastake
translated: Let these ten mantra-Vidyas remain on my head.

original: śubhā me cāgratasthātu yoginī sthātu dakṣiṇe // //
analyzed: śubhā me ca agratasthātu yoginī sthātu dakṣiṇe  /
translated: And the auspicious Yoginī should stand to the right.

original: vāmāṅge ratikāle ca paścame sthātu śṛnkhalā /
analyzed: vāma aṅge rati kāle ca paścame sthātu śṛnkhalā
translated: And Śṛṅkhalā should stand to the left at the time of enjoyment.

original: p / śikhā me śaṅkhinī rayodastaṃ vastravatī śubhā // //
analyzed: śikhā me śaṅkhinī raya udastam vastravatī śubhā
translated: My crest-jewel is Śaṅkhinī, the weapon is Vastravatī, and the auspicious one is

original: kavace kavacāṅgī ca netre netrakṛtotsavā /🔽prakaṭā gopitāḥ sarvā bhīṣaṇā bhairavī śivā // //
analyzed: kavace kavaca aṅgī ca netre netra kṛta utsavā  prakaṭāḥ gopitāḥ sarvāḥ bhīṣaṇā bhairavī śivā
translated: The armor is Kavacāṅgī, and the eyes are the festival of the eyes.🔽All are hidden, terrifying, Bhairavī, and auspicious.

analyzed: saṃbhramā jayinī hamsā subhagā jaladevatā
translated: The swan is victorious, very fortunate, the deity of the clouds,

analyzed: yakṣiṇī cūḍakanyā ca tathā ca ākāśagāminī
translated: The Yakṣiṇī, the maiden of the crest, and likewise the sky-goer,
The deity of all Āgamas, the earth-wanderer, and the moving Kumbhī,

original: raṅgiṇī deva maitrī ca prasiddhā madirālikā // //
analyzed: raṅgiṇī deva maitrī ca prasiddhā madirālikā
translated: The famous Madirālikā, the deity of the stage, and the friend of the gods,

analyzed: pūjitā sarva sidhi artham śāstre ismin yoginīmate
translated: Having been worshipped for the sake of all accomplishments in this scripture, the Yoginīmata,

analyzed: sthāyinī gadyate sadbhiḥ sa ānanda vana vāsinī
translated: The one who resides in the forest of bliss is called the permanent one by the good.

analyzed: catur saṣṭhī āśrayā devī trivarga artha pradāyinī
translated: The goddess who is the support of the sixty-four, the bestower of the fruits of the three goals,

analyzed: namaḥ astu te jagannāthe namaḥ astu bhuvaneśvarī
translated: Salutations to you, O Lord of the world, salutations to you, O Mistress of the universe.

original: namo bhogaprade devi namo devi maheśvarī /
analyzed: namaḥ bhoga prade devi namaḥ devi maheśvarī
translated: Salutations to you, O Goddess who grants enjoyment, salutations to you, O Great Goddess.

analyzed: namaḥ saṃhāra pāra sthe namaḥ nirvāṇa dāyinī
translated: Salutations to you who are established in the state of dissolution, salutations to you who grant liberation.

analyzed: namaḥ astu te mahādevī namaḥ saṃsāra tāriṇī
translated: Salutations to you, O great goddess, salutations to the savior from worldly existence.

original: p / ityetāstu mahāśambho yoginyo yena cintitāḥ // //
analyzed: iti etāḥ tu mahā śambho yoginyaḥ yena cintitāḥ
translated: Thus, O great Śambhu, are those yoginīs contemplated by him.

original: ādhāre līyamānastu sa yogī yogavid bhavet /
analyzed: ādhāre līyamānaḥ tu sa yogī yoga vid bhavet
translated: The yogī who dissolves in the foundation will become a knower of yoga.

analyzed: tiṣṭhanti yoginīrūpāḥ trailokya sacarācare
translated: They remain in the form of yoginīs, in the three worlds with their moving and unmoving beings.

original: yoginyo yāstu tāḥ sarvā dṛḍhaṃ kurvatu me vapuḥ /
analyzed: yoginyaḥ yāḥ tu tāḥ sarvāḥ dṛḍham kurvatu me vapuḥ
translated: May all those yoginīs firmly make my body.

analyzed: aham brahma ādi aham viṣṇuḥ aham eva maheśvaraḥ
translated: I am Brahmā, I am Viṣṇu, I am Maheśvara myself.

analyzed: sarva bhūta nivāsaḥ aham loke śakti vicintakaḥ
translated: I am the abode of all beings, the thinker of power in the world.

analyzed: śakti nyāsa kṛtena atra śarīreṇa sura asurāḥ
translated: By this body, in which the deposition of power has been done, the gods and demons

analyzed: pradiddha uddeśa mātreṇa ājñām kurvatu me sadā
translated: are well-known. May they always grant me the command, merely by the indication of the goal.

analyzed: yat kiñcid yoginī rūpam trailokye ca asti śaṅkara
translated: Whatever exists in the form of yoginīs in the three worlds, O Śaṅkara,

original: tatsarvaṃ tiṣṭhate dehe śaktinyāse kṛte sati /
analyzed: tat sarvam tiṣṭhate dehe śakti nyāse kṛte sati
translated: all that remains in the body, when the deposition of power is done.

original: kāminī kurute vāpi yaṃ nyāsaṃ śaktinirmitam // //
analyzed: kāminī kurute vā api yam nyāsam śakti nirmitam
translated: Or a woman who performs the deposition created by power

original: tāṃ devīṃ divyarūpasthāṃ saṃsāra tripurāṃ viduḥ /
analyzed: tām devīm divya rūpa sthām saṃsāra tripurām viduḥ
translated: knows that goddess, abiding in a divine form, as the Tripura of the world.

original: putrāṇāṃ ca tathā deyaṃ bhaktānāṃ ca viśeṣataḥ // //
analyzed: putrāṇām ca tathā deyam bhaktānām ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: It should also be given to the sons and especially to the devotees.

original: śaktinyāsamidaṃ deyaṃ na deyaṃ yasya kasyacit /
analyzed: śakti nyāsam idam deyam na deyam yasya kasyacid
translated: This deposition of power should be given, not to anyone and everyone.
For humans in the world of earth, it grants the fruits of desired goals.

original: yaḥ karoti mama nyāsaṃ ṣoḍhānyāsādhikaṃ vibho /
analyzed: yaḥ karoti mama nyāsam ṣoḍhā nyāsa adhikam vibho
translated: O Lord, he who performs my six-fold mudra practice,

analyzed: sa jīvet śakti rūpeṇa trailokya unmūlana kṣama
translated: He will live in the form of Shakti, capable of uprooting the three worlds.

original: śaktinyāsakṛte jīve yaḥ kaścit kṣobhako bhavet /
analyzed: śakti nyāsa kṛte jīve yaḥ kaścid kṣobhakaḥ bhavet
translated: If anyone who has performed the Shakti mudra practice becomes agitated,

original: karmaṇā manasā vācā tasya mūrdhā patiṣyati // //
analyzed: karmaṇā manasā vācā tasya mūrdhā patiṣyati  /
translated: His head will fall, by his actions, thoughts, and words.

analyzed: evam śakti nyāsam vidhāya mahācakreśvarī nyāsam kuryāt
translated: Having performed the Shakti mudra practice in this way, one should perform the mudra practice of the great Chakrasvari.

original: pūrvavat hṛdikaraṣaḍaṅgadhyānapūrvaṃ yathā śaktiṃ japitvā japaṃ pūrvavatsamarpayet /
analyzed: pūrvavat hṛdikara ṣaḍaṅga dhyāna pūrvam yathā śaktim japitvā japam pūrvavat samarpayet
translated: As before, having meditated on the six limbs of the heart and hands, having repeated as much as one can, one should offer the repetition as before.

analyzed: asya śrī prāsāda parāpara prāsāda mantrasya saccidānanda bhairava ṛṣiḥ cit maya chandaḥ
translated: This mantra of the Shri Prasada Para Aparaprasada has the Rishi of Sachidananda Bhairava, the Chanda of the mind,

original: śrīparāmbā devatā haṃ bījaṃ auṃ śaktiḥ saḥ kīlakaṃ mama parāmbāprasādasidhyarthe jape
analyzed: śrī parā ambā devatā haṃ bījam aum śaktiḥ saḥ kīlakam mama parā ambā prasāda sidhi arthe jape
translated: The deity is Shri Parama, the seed is Ham, the Shakti is Aum, the Ketaka is Sah. For the sake of accomplishing the grace of my Parama, I repeat.

original: viniyogaḥ /🔽śirasi ṛṣaye namaḥ / mukhe chandase namaḥ /
analyzed: viniyogaḥ  śirasi ṛṣaye namaḥ mukhe chandase namaḥ
translated: The application is:🔽At the head, salutations to the Rishi. In the mouth, salutations to the Chanda.

original: hṛdaye devatāyai namaḥ / dakṣastane bījāya namaḥ /
analyzed: hṛdaye devatāyai namaḥ dakṣa stane bījāya namaḥ
translated: In the heart, salutations to the deity. In the right breast, salutations to the seed.

original: vāmastane śaktaye namaḥ / nābhau kīlakāya pādayo viniyogaḥ / hsā shāmityādikaraṣaḍaṅganyāsaḥ
analyzed: vāma stane śaktaye namaḥ nābhau kīlakāya pādayaḥ viniyogaḥ hsā shāṃ ityādi kara ṣaḍaṅganyāsaḥ
translated: In the left breast, salutations to Shakti. At the navel, salutations to the peg. At the feet, the application. The six-limbed assignment of the hands beginning with Hsa Shya.

original: p / oṃ aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ īśānāya namaḥ aṅguṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: om aim   śrīṃ   shauṃḥ īśānāya namaḥ aṅguṣṭhābhyām namaḥ
translated: Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsaum Shraum, salutations to Isha. To the thumbs, salutations.

analyzed: tatpuruṣāya namaḥ tarjanībhyām namaḥ
translated: To Tatpurusha, salutations. To the index fingers, salutations.

analyzed: aghorāya namaḥ madhyamābhyām namaḥ
translated: To Aghora, salutations. To the middle fingers, salutations.

analyzed: vāmadevāya namaḥ anāmikābhyām namaḥ
translated: To Vamadeva, salutations. To the ring fingers, salutations.

original: sadyojātāya namaḥ kaniṣṭhikābhyāṃ namaḥ /🔽mūrdhni haṃ namaḥ / mukhe yaṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: sadyojātāya namaḥ kaniṣṭhikābhyām namaḥ  mūrdhni haṃ namaḥ mukhe  yaṃ namaḥ
translated: To Sadyojata, salutations. To the little fingers, salutations.🔽On the head, salutations to Ham. In the mouth, salutations to Yam.

original: hṛdi raṃ namaḥ / nābhau vaṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: hṛdi raṃ namaḥ nābhau    namaḥ
translated: In the heart, salutations to Ram. At the navel, salutations to Vam.

original: mūlādhāre laṃ namaḥ / iti dvivāraṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: mūlādhāre    namaḥ iti dvi vāram kuryāt
translated: At the root of the genitals, salutations to Lam. This should be done twice.

original: śirasi īśānāya namaḥ / mukhe tatpuruṣāya namaḥ /
analyzed: śirasi īśānāya namaḥ mukhe tatpuruṣāya namaḥ
translated: On the head, salutations to Isha. In the mouth, salutations to Tatpurusha.

original: hṛdaye aghorāya namaḥ / nābhau vāmadevāya namaḥ /
analyzed: hṛdaye   aghorāya namaḥ nābhau vāmadevāya namaḥ
translated: In the heart, salutations to Aghora. At the navel, salutations to Vamadeva.

analyzed: mūlādhāre sadyojātāya namaḥ
translated: At the root of the genitals, salutations to Sadyojata.

original: mūlādhāre sadyojātāya namaḥ / nābhau vāmadevāya namaḥ /
analyzed: mūlādhāre   sadyojātāya namaḥ nābhau vāmadevāya namaḥ
translated: At the navel, salutations to Vamadeva.

original: hṛdi aghorāya namaḥ / mukhe tatpuruṣāya namaḥ /
analyzed: hṛdi aghorāya namaḥ mukhe tatpuruṣāya namaḥ
translated: In the heart, salutations to Aghora. In the mouth, salutations to Tatpurusha.

analyzed: śirasi  īśānāya namaḥ sahasra dala paṅkaje dhyātvā
translated: On the head, salutations to Isha. Having meditated on the thousand-petaled lotus,

analyzed: īśānāya namaḥ ūrdhva vaktrāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Isha, the upper face.

original: tatpuruṣāya namaḥ pūrvavaktrāya namaḥ /🔽aghorāya namaḥ dakṣiṇavaktrāya namaḥ /
analyzed: tatpuruṣāya namaḥ pūrva vaktrāya namaḥ  aghorāya namaḥ dakṣiṇa vaktrāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Tatpurusha, the eastern face.🔽Salutations to Aghora, the southern face.

analyzed: sadyojātāya namaḥ paścima vaktrāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Sadyojata, the western face.

analyzed: vāmadevāya namaḥ uttara vaktrāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Vamadeva, the northern face.

original: hsāṃ shāmityādiṣaḍaṅganyāsaṃ vidhāya mahāṣoḍhānyāsaṃ kuryāt / taduktaṃ kulaprakāśatantre
translated: Having performed the six-limbed nyasa with hsam, sram etc., one should perform the Maha Shodhana nyasa. It is said in the Kula Prakash Tantra

original: p / mahāṣoḍhāhvayaṃ nyāsaṃ tataḥ kuryāt samāhitaḥ /
translated: Then, with a concentrated mind, one should perform the nyasa called Maha Shodhana.

analyzed: vakṣyamāṇena vidhinā devatā bhāva siddhaye
translated: By the method to be described, for the attainment of the state of the deity.

original: yasya kasyāpi naivoktaṃ tava snehād vadāmyaham /
analyzed: yasya kasya api nā evā uktam tava snehāt vadāmi aham
translated: It is not mentioned by anyone, but out of affection for you, I am telling it.

analyzed: prapañcaḥ bhuvanam mūrti mantra daivata mātaraḥ
translated: The universe, the world, the embodied deities, and the mothers.
The nyasa called Maha Shodhana is the best of all nyama.

original: asya prayogo yathā 🔽oṃ aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ aṃ prapañcarūpāyai śriyai namaḥ mūrdhni /
analyzed: asya prayogaḥ yathā  om aim   śrīṃ     aṃ prapañca rūpāyai śriyai namaḥ mūrdhni
translated: The application of this is as follows:🔽Om, Aim, Hrim, Shrim, Hsaum, Shaum, A, salutations to Shri, the form of the universe, on the head.

original: hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ āṃ dvīparūpāyai māyāyai namaḥ mukhe /
analyzed: hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ ām dvīpa rūpāyai māyāyai namaḥ mukhe
translated: Hsaum, Shaum, A, salutations to Maya, the form of the island, in the mouth.

original: hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ iṃ jaladhirūpāyai kamalāyai namaḥ dakṣanetre /
analyzed: hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ iṃ jaladhi rūpāyai kamalāyai namaḥ dakṣa netre
translated: Hsaum Shaum Im - Salutations to Kamala, the form of the ocean, in the right eye.

original: hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ īṃ girirūpāyai viṣṇuvallabhāyai namaḥ vāmanetre /🔽hsauṃ shauṃ uṃ pattanarūpāyai padmadhāriṇyai namaḥ dakṣakarṇe /🔽hsauṃ shauṃ ūṃ pīṭharūpāyai samudratanayāyai namaḥ vāmakarṇe /
analyzed: hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ īṃ giri rūpāyai viṣṇu vallabhāyai namaḥ vāmanetre      um pattana rūpāyai padma dhāriṇyai namaḥ dakṣa karṇe      ūm pīṭha rūpāyai samudratanayāyai namaḥ vāma karṇe
translated: Hsaum Shaum Eem - Salutations to Vishnuvallabha, the form of the mountain, in the left eye.🔽Hsaum Shaum Um - Salutations to the form of the city, the lotus-holder, in the right ear.🔽Hsaum Shaum Uum - Salutations to the form of the seat, the daughter of the ocean, in the left ear.

original: hsauṃ shauṃ ṛṃ kṣetrarūpāyai lokamātre namaḥ dakṣanāsāyām /
analyzed: hsauṃ shauṃ ṛṃ kṣetra rūpāyai loka mātre namaḥ dakṣa nāsāyām
translated: Hsaum Shaum Rims - Salutations to the form of the field, the measure of the world, in the right nostril.

original: prāsādaparā parāprāsādabījaṃ ādau yojanīyam /🔽ṝṃ vanarūpāyai kamalavāsinyai namaḥ vāmanāsāyām /🔽ḷṃ āśramarūpāyai indirāyai namaḥ dakṣagaṇḍe /
analyzed: prāsāda parā parā prāsāda bījam ādau yojanīyam  ṝṃ vana rūpāyai kamala vāsinyai namaḥ vāma nāsāyām    āśrama rūpāyai indirāyai namaḥ dakṣa gaṇḍe
translated: The seed of Prasada and Para-Prasada should be used at the beginning.🔽Rims - Salutations to the form of the forest, the dweller in the lotus, in the left nostril.🔽Laim - Salutations to the form of the hermitage, Indhira, in the right cheek.

analyzed: ḹṃ guhā rūpāyai māyai namaḥ vāma gaṇḍe
translated: Laum - Salutations to Maya, the form of the cave, in the left cheek.

original: eṃ nadīrūpāyai ramāyai namaḥ ūrdhvoṣṭhe /🔽aiṃ catvararūpāyai padmāyai namaḥ adharoṣṭhe /
analyzed: em nadī rūpāyai ramāyai namaḥ ūrdhva uṣṭhe  aim catvara rūpāyai padmāyai namaḥ adhara uṣṭhe
translated: Eim - Salutations to Rama, the form of the river, on the upper lip.🔽Aim - Salutations to Padma, the form of the crossroads, on the lower lip.

analyzed: om udbhija rūpāyai nārāyaṇa priyāyai namaḥ ūrdhva dante
translated: Om - Salutations to Narayana's beloved, the form of the udumbara flower, on the upper teeth.

original: p / auṃ svedajarūpāyai siddhalakṣmyai namaḥ adhodante /
analyzed: aum sveda ja rūpāyai siddhalakṣmyai namaḥ adhas dante
translated: Paum - Salutations to Siddhilakshmi, the form of sweat-born, on the lower teeth.

analyzed: aṃ aṇḍaja rūpāyai rāja lakṣmyai namaḥ mukhe
translated: Om, salutations to the mouth of the Goddess of Royal Glory in the form of eggs and wombs.

original: aḥ jarāyujarūpāyai mahālakṣmyai namaḥ mukhe /🔽kaṃ kālarūpāyai āryāyai namaḥ dakṣakakṣāyām /

translated: Ah, salutations to the mouth of the Great Goddess in the form of wombs and embryos.🔽Kam, salutations to the right armpit of the Goddess in the form of Time.

original: khaṃ tuṭirūpāyai anāyai namaḥ kūrpare /🔽gaṃ kalārūpāyai caṇḍikāyai namaḥ maṇibandhe /

translated: Kham, salutations to the wrist of the Goddess in the form of moments.🔽Gam, salutations to the wrist of the Goddess in the form of Kalas.

original: ghaṃ kāṭyārūpāyai durgāyai namaḥ aṅgulimūle /🔽ṅaṃ nimiṣarūpāyai śivāyai namaḥ aṅgulyagre /

original: caṃ śvāsarūpāyai aparṇāyai namaḥ vāmakakṣāyām /🔽chaṃ ghaṭikārūpāyai ambikāyai namaḥ kūrpare /

translated: Cham, salutations to the left armpit of the Goddess in the form of breaths.🔽Cham, salutations to the wrist of the Goddess in the form of Ghatikas.

original: jaṃ mūhūrtarūpāyai satyai namaḥ vāmamaṇibandhe /🔽jhaṃ prahararūpāyai īśvaryai namaḥ aṅgulimūle /
analyzed: jaṃ mūhūrta rūpāyai satyai namaḥ vāma maṇibandhe  jhaṃ prahara rūpāyai īśvaryai namaḥ aṅguli mūle
translated: Jam, salutations to the left wrist of the Goddess in the form of Muhurtas.🔽Jham, salutations to the base of the fingers of the Goddess in the form of Praharas.

original: ñaṃ divasarūpāyai śāmbhavyai namaḥ vāmaaṅgulyagre /🔽ṭaṃ sandhyārūpāyai īśānyai namaḥ dakṣapādamūle /
analyzed: ñaṃ divasa rūpāyai śāmbhavyai namaḥ vāma aṅguli agre  ṭaṃ sandhyā rūpāyai īśānyai namaḥ dakṣa pāda mūle
translated: Nam, salutations to the tips of the fingers of the Goddess in the form of days.🔽Tam, salutations to the base of the right foot of the Goddess in the form of Sandhyas.

analyzed: ṭhaṃ rātri rūpāyai pārvatyai namaḥ jānau
translated: Tham, salutations to the knee of the Goddess in the form of nights.

analyzed: ḍaṃ tithi rūpāyai sarva maṅgalāyai namaḥ gulphe
translated: Dam, salutations to the ankle of the Goddess in the form of lunar days.🔽Dham, salutations to the toes of the Goddess in the form of fortnights.

analyzed: ḍhaṃ vāra rūpāyai dākṣāyiṇyai namaḥ aṅguli mūle
translated: Dham to Dakshayani, the form of the Varuha incarnation, salutations at the base of the fingers.

original: ṇaṃ nakṣatrarūpāyai haimavatyai namaḥ aṅgulyagre /🔽taṃ yogarūpāyai mahāmāyāyai namaḥ vāmapādamūle /

translated: Tham to Mahesvari, the form of Karana, salutations at the knee.🔽 Dam to Mridani, the form of the Paksha, salutations at the ankle.

analyzed: dhaṃ māsa rūpāyai rudrāṇyai namaḥ aṅguli mūle
translated: Dham to Rudrani, the form of the month, salutations at the base of the fingers.

original: naṃ rāśirūpāyai śarvāṇyai namaḥ aṅgulyagre /🔽paṃ ruturūpāyai parameśvaryai namaḥ dakṣapārśve /
analyzed: naṃ rāśi rūpāyai śarvāṇyai namaḥ aṅguli agre  paṃ rutu rūpāyai parameśvaryai namaḥ dakṣa pārśve
translated: Nam to Sharvani, the form of the Rashi, salutations at the tip of the fingers.🔽 Pam to Parameश्वरी, the form of the Ruta, salutations on the right side.

original: p / phaṃ ayanarūpāyai kālyai namaḥ vāmapārśve /

translated: Bam to Katyayini, the form of the Samvatsara, salutations on the back.

original: yaṃ pañcabhūtarūpāyai brāhmyai namaḥ hṛdi /🔽raṃ pañcatanmātrarūpāyai vāgīśvaryai namaḥ dakṣāṃse /

analyzed: saṃ antaḥkaraṇa catuṣṭaya rūpāyai vāc pradāyai namaḥ dakṣa pāṇi pāda antam
translated: Sam to the giver of speech in the form of the four internal organs, salutations up to the right hand and foot.

Lam to Bharati in the form of the seven constituents, salutations on the belly and face.

translated: Hsaum Hsaum Ksham to the one with the three humors, in the form of Vidhatri, salutations pervading. Thus one should assign in the places of the alphabet. Then🔽Om Aim Hrim Shrim Hsaum Hsaum Am Ah etc. up to Ksham, having uttered the alphabet,

translated: Vam Sham to the Goddess Sarvesvari, who is served by thousands of crores of Brahma families, salutations on the right side of the neck.

original: maṃ yaṃ sahasrakoṭikṣetrapālakulasevitāyai kālarātryambādevyai namaḥ dakṣaskandhe /
analyzed: maṃ yaṃ sahasra koṭi kṣetrapāla kula sevitāyai kālarātri ambā devyai namaḥ dakṣa skandhe
translated: Mam Yam to the Goddess Kalaratri, who is served by thousands of crores of Kshetrapala families, salutations on the right shoulder.

original: raṃ laṃ sahasrakoṭipramathakulasevitāyai bhagavatyambādevyai namaḥ vāmaskandhe /
analyzed: raṃ laṃ sahasra koṭi pramatha kula sevitāyai bhagavatī ambā devyai namaḥ vāma skandhe
translated: Ram Lam to the Goddess Bhagavati, who is served by thousands of crores of Pramatha families, salutations on the left shoulder.🔽 Vam Sham to the Goddess Sarvesvari, who is served by thousands of crores of Brahma families, salutations on the right side of the neck.

original: vaṃ śaṃ sahasrakoṭibrahmakulasevitāyai sarveśvaryambādevyai namaḥ dakṣakaṇṭhabhāge /
analyzed: vaṃ śam sahasra koṭi brahma kula sevitāyai sarva īśvarā ambā devyai namaḥ dakṣa kaṇṭha bhāge
translated: Mam Yam to the Goddess Kalaratri, who is served by thousands of crores of Kshetrapala families, salutations on the right shoulder.🔽 Ram Lam to the Goddess Bhagavati, who is served by thousands of crores of Pramatha families, salutations on the left shoulder.🔽 Vam Sham to the Goddess Sarvesvari, who is served by thousands of crores of Brahma families, salutations on the right side of the neck.

original: ṣaṃ saṃ sahasrakoṭiviṣṇukulasevitāyai sarvajñāmbādevyai namaḥ vāmakaṇṭhabhāge /🔽haṃ laṃ sahasrakoṭirudrakulasevitāyai sarvakartryambādevyai namaḥ dakṣaśirobhāge /
analyzed: ṣaṃ saṃ sahasra koṭi viṣṇu kula sevitāyai sarvajña ambā devyai namaḥ vāma kaṇṭha bhāge  haṃ laṃ sahasra koṭi rudra kula sevitāyai sarva kartrī ambā devyai namaḥ dakṣa śiraḥ bhāge
translated: Om, Hrim, Shrim, Hsaum, Shaum, to the mother goddess who is served by the families of thousands of crores of Visnus, salutations on the left side of the throat.🔽 Om, Lam, to the mother goddess who is served by the families of thousands of crores of Rudras, salutations on the right side of the head.

original: hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ kṣaṃ carācarakulasevitāyai kulaśaktyambādevyai namaḥ vāmaśirobhāge /
analyzed: hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ   carācara kula sevitāyai kula śakti ambā devyai namaḥ vāma śiraḥ bhāge
translated: Om, Hsaum, Shaum, Ksham, to the mother goddess who is served by the families of the moving and unmoving, salutations on the left side of the head.

original: hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ aṃ āṃ ityādikṣāntaṃ sakaladevatādhipāyai parāmbādevyai namaḥ iti vyāpakaṃ
analyzed: hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ aṃ āṃ ityādi kṣā antam sakala devatā adhipāyai para ambā devyai namaḥ iti vyāpakam
translated: Om, Hsaum, Shaum, A, A, etc. up to Ksha, to the supreme mother goddess who is the lord of all the deities, salutations. Thus one should perform the pervasion.

analyzed: kuryāt iti daivata nyāsaḥ
translated: This is the Nyasa of the deities.

analyzed: atha mātaranyāsaḥ
translated: Now, the Nyasa of the Mothers.

original: p / oṃ aiṃ hrīṃ śrīṃ hsauṃḥ shauṃḥ kaṃ khaṃ gaṃ ghaṃ ṅaṃ anantakoṭibhūcarīkulasevitāyai
analyzed: om aim   śrīṃ
translated: Om, Aim, Hrim, Shrim, Hsaum, Shaum, Kam, Kham, Gam, Gham, Ngam, to the mother goddess who is served by the families of countless crores of Bhucharis,

original: āṃ āṃ maṅgalāmbādevyai āṃ śāṃ brahmāṇyambādevyai anantakoṭibhūtakulasahitāyai aṃ kṣaṃ
analyzed: āṃ āṃ maṅgalāmbā devyai āṃ śāṃ brahmāṇī ambā devyai ananta koṭi bhūta kula sahitāyai aṃ
translated: Aim, Lam, to the mother goddess Mangala, Aim, Sham, to the mother goddess Brahmani, to the one accompanied by the families of countless crores of ghosts, Am, Ksham,

original: maṅgalanāthāya aṃ kṣaṃ asitāṅgabhairavanāthāya namaḥ mūlādhāre /
analyzed: maṅgala nāthāya aṃ   asita aṅga bhairava nāthāya namaḥ mūlādhāre
translated: to the lord of Mangala, Am, Ksham, to the lord of Asitanga Bhairava, salutations at the base of the spine.

original: caṃ chaṃ jaṃ jhaṃ ñaṃ anantakoṭikhecarīkulasahitāyai īṃ lāṃ carcikāmbādevyai īṃ lāṃ
analyzed: caṃ chaṃ jaṃ jhaṃ ñaṃ ananta koṭi khecarī kula sahitāyai īṃ lāṃ carcikā ambā devyai īṃ lāṃ
translated: Cham, Chham, Jam, Jham, Njam, to the one accompanied by the families of countless crores of Khecharis, Eem, Laam, to the mother goddess Charcika, Eem, Laam,

original: māheśvaryambādevyai anantakoṭivetālakulasahitāya īṃ laṃ carcikānāthāya iṃ laṃ rurubhairavanāthāya
analyzed: māheśvarī ambā devyai ananta koṭi vetāla kula sahitāya īṃ laṃ carcikā nāthāya iṃ laṃ rurubhairava nāthāya
translated: Mahesvarambadevyai, Anantakoti-Vetalakula-Sahitaya, Im Lam, Charcikana-Thaya, Im Lam, Ruru-Bhairav-Na-Thaya.

analyzed: namaḥ svādhiṣṭhāne
translated: Salutations in the Swadhisthana.

original: ṭaṃ ṭhaṃ ḍaṃ ḍhaṃ ṇaṃ anantakoṭi kulasahitāyai uṃ hāṃ kaumāryambādevyai
analyzed: ṭaṃ ṭhaṃ ḍaṃ ḍhaṃ ṇaṃ anantakoṭi kula sahitāyai um hāṃ kaumārī ambā devyai
translated: Tam Tham Dam Dham Nam, Anantakoti-Kula-Sahitaya, Um Ham, Kaumarambadevyai.

original: anantakoṭipiśācakulasahitāya uṃ haṃ yogīśvaranāthāya uṃ haṃ caṇḍabhairavanāthāya namaḥ
analyzed: ananta koṭi piśāca kula sahitāya um haṃ yogīśvara nāthāya um haṃ caṇḍabhairava nāthāya namaḥ
translated: Anantakoti-Pishacha-Kula-Sahitaya, Um Ham, Yogishvara-Na-Thaya, Um Ham, Chandabhairav-Na-Thaya.

analyzed: maṇipūre
translated: Salutations in the Manipura.

original: taṃ thaṃ daṃ dhaṃ naṃ anantakoṭidikcarīkulasahitāyai ṝṃ sāṃ harasidhyambādevyai ṝṃ sāṃ vai
analyzed: taṃ thaṃ daṃ dhaṃ naṃ ananta koṭi dikcarī kula sahitāyai ṝ sāṃ hara sidhi ambā devyai ṝ sāṃ vai
translated: Tam Tham Dam Dham Nam, Anantakoti-Dikchari-Kula-Sahitaya, Rum Sam, Harasiddhyambadevyai, Rum Sam,

original: vyambādevyai anantakoṭiapasmārakulasahitāya ṛṃ saṃ harasiddhanāthāya ṛṃ saṃ
analyzed: vyambā devyai ananta koṭi apasmāra kula sahitāya ṛṃ saṃ hara siddha nāthāya ṛṃ saṃ
translated: Vayambadevyai, Anantakoti-Apasmara-Kula-Sahitaya, Rum Sam, Harasiddha-Na-Thaya, Rum Sam,

original: krodhabhairavanāthāya namaḥ anāhate /🔽paṃ phaṃ baṃ bhaṃ maṃ anantakoṭisahacarīkulasahitāyai ḹṃ ṣāṃ bhavyambādevyai ḷṃ ṣāṃ
analyzed: paṃ phaṃ baṃ bhaṃ maṃ ananta koṭi sahacarī kula sahitāyai ḹṃ ṣāṃ bhavi ambā devyai ḷṃ ṣāṃ
translated: Krodha-Bhairav-Na-Thaya. Salutations in the Anahata.🔽Pam Pham Bam Bham Mam, Anantakoti-Sahchari-Kula-Sahitaya, Lum Sham, Bhavyambadevyai, Lum Sham,

original: vārāhyambādevyai anantakoṭibrahmarākṣakulasahitāya ḷṃ ṣaṃ bhaṭṭanāthāya ḷṃ ṣaṃ
analyzed: vārāhī ambā devyai ananta koṭi brahmarākṣa kula sahitāya ḷṃ ṣaṃ bhaṭṭanāthāya ḷṃ ṣaṃ
translated: Varahyam-Ba-Devyai, Anantakoti-Brahmara-Ksha-Kula-Sahitaya, Lum Sham, Bhatta-Na-Thaya, Lum Sham,

analyzed: unmatta bhairava nāthāya namaḥ viśuddhau
translated: Unmatta-Bhairav-Na-Thaya. Salutations in the Vishuddha.

original: yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ anantakoṭigiricarīkulasahitāyai aiṃ śāṃ kilakilāmbādevyai aiṃ śāṃ
analyzed: yaṃ raṃ laṃ vaṃ ananta koṭigiricarī kula sahitāyai aim śāṃ kilakilā ambā devyai aim śāṃ
translated: Yam Ram Lam Vam to the endless millions of mountain-dwelling clans, to the goddess Aum Sham Kilikila, Aum Sham.

original: indrāṇyambādevyai anantakoṭiceṭakakulasahitāya eṃ śaṃ kilikilānāthāya eṃ śaṃ
analyzed: indrāṇī ambā devyai ananta koṭi ceṭaka kula sahitāya eṃ śam kilikilā nāthāya eṃ śam
translated: To the goddess Indraani, to the endless millions of servant clans, to the lord Aum Sham Kilikila, Aum Sham.

original: kapālībhairavanāthāya namaḥ ājñāyām /🔽p / śaṃ ṣaṃ saṃ haṃ anantakoṭivanacarīkulasahitāyai auṃ vāṃ kālarātryambādevyai auṃ
analyzed: kapālī bhairava nāthāya namaḥ ājñāyām  śam ṣaṃ saṃ haṃ ananta koṭi vanacarī kula sahitāyai aum vām kālarātri ambā devyai aum
translated: To the lord Kapalibhairava, homage in the forehead.🔽P. Sham Sham Sam Ham to the endless millions of forest-dwelling clans, to the goddess Aum Vam Kalaratri, Aum Vam.

original: vāṃ cāmuṇḍādevyai anantakoṭipretakulasahitāya oṃ vaṃ kālarātrināthāya oṃ vaṃ
analyzed: vām cāmuṇḍā devyai ananta koṭi preta kula sahitāya om vaṃ kālarātri nāthāya om vaṃ
translated: To the goddess Chamundaa, to the endless millions of ghosts, to the lord Aum Vam Kalaratri, Aum Vam.

original: bhīṣaṇabhairavanāthāya namaḥ bhāle /🔽laṃ kṣaṃ anantakoṭijalacarīkulasahitāyai aḥ lāṃ bhīṣaṇāmbādevyai aḥ lāṃ mahālakṣmyambādevyai
analyzed: bhīṣaṇa bhairava nāthāya namaḥ bhāle  laṃ kṣaṃ ananta koṭi jalacarī kula sahitāyai aḥ lāṃ bhīṣaṇā ambā devyai aḥ lāṃ mahālakṣmī ambā devyai
translated: To the lord Bhisana Bhairava, homage in the forehead.🔽Lam Ksham to the endless millions of water-dwelling clans, to the goddess Aum Lam Bhisana, Aum Lam Mahaa Lakshmi,

original: anantakoṭikūṣmāṇḍakulasahitāya aṃ laṃ bhīṣaṇanāthāya aṃ laṃ saṃhārabhairavanāthāya namaḥ 🔽brahmarandhre /
analyzed: ananta koṭi kūṣmāṇḍa kula sahitāya aṃ laṃ bhīṣaṇa nāthāya aṃ laṃ saṃhāra bhairava nāthāya namaḥ  brahmarandhre
translated: To the endless millions of Koshmanda clans, to the lord Aum Lam Bhisana, Aum Lam Samhara Bhairava, homage in the Brahma-aperture.

original: aṃ āṃ ityādikṣāntaṃ samastamātṛbhairavādhipāyai parāmbādevyai namaḥ vyāpakaṃ kuryāt / iti
analyzed: aṃ āṃ ityādi kṣā antam samasta mātṛ bhairava adhipāyai para ambā devyai namaḥ vyāpakam kuryāt iti
translated: Aum Aum and so on up to Ksha, to the supreme goddess Ambaa, the mistress of all the Matrkas and Bhairavas, one should perform the all-pervading. Thus

analyzed: mātṛkā nyāsaḥ
translated: is the Nyasa of the Matrkas.

original: tato hsāṃ shauṃ hsīṃ shīṃ ṣaṭdīrghabījena ṣaḍaṅgaṃ vidhāya devaṃ dhyāyet
analyzed: tatas hsām shaum hsīṃ shīṃ ṣaṣ dīrghabījena ṣaḍaṅgam vidhāya devam dhyāyet
translated: Then, having done the six-limbs with the six long seed-mantras HSRAM SHROM HSRIM SHRIM, one should meditate on the Lord.

analyzed: dhyāna mahākulaprakāśatantre
translated: In the meditation, in the Mahakulaprakashatantra:

original: evaṃ nyasta tanurdevī dhyāyed devamananyadhīḥ /🔽amṛtārṇavamadhyastha ratnadīpe manorame //
analyzed: evam tanuḥ devī dhyāyet devam an anya dhīḥ  ratna dīpe manorame
translated: Thus, having placed the body, the Goddess should meditate on the Lord with a mind solely devoted to Him.🔽In the middle of an ocean of nectar, in a beautiful jeweled lamp,
In a forest of wish-fulfilling trees, in a pavilion of nine-jeweled ornaments,

analyzed: nava ratna mayam śrīmat siṃhāsana āgata ambuje
translated: In a beautiful lotus throne made of nine jewels,

analyzed: trikoṇa antar samāsīnam candra sūrya yutam prabham
translated: Seated in the middle of a triangle, with the light of the moon and sun,

analyzed: ardha ambikā samāyuktam pravibhakta vibhūṣaṇam
translated: United with half of Ambika, adorned with distinct ornaments,

analyzed: koṭi kandarpa lāvaṇyam sadā ṣoḍaśa vārṣikam
translated: With a beauty of a million Kamadevas, always sixteen years old,
With a lotus face with a gentle smile, three eyes, and the moon on his head,

analyzed: divya ambara sraj ālepa divya ābharaṇa bhūṣitam
translated: Adorned with divine garments, garlands, ointments, and divine ornaments,

original: pānapātraṃ ca cinmudrāṃ triśūlaṃ pustakaṃ karaiḥ //
analyzed: pāna pātram ca cit mudrām triśūlam pustakam karaiḥ
translated: Holding a drinking vessel, a gesture of meditation, a trident, and a book in his hands,

analyzed: vidyā sam sadi bibhrāṇam sadānanda mukha īkṣaṇam
translated: Bearing Vidyas, always with a blissful face and eyes,

analyzed: mahā ṣoḍhā udita aśeṣa devatā gaṇa sevitam
translated: Served by the entire host of deities arisen from the great Shodashi,

analyzed: evam citta ambuje dhyāyet ardhanārīśvaram śivam
translated: One should meditate on Shiva, the Lord of half a woman, in the lotus of the mind in this way.

original: puruṣaṃ vā smared devīṃ strīrūpaṃ vā vicintayet //
analyzed: puruṣam vā smaret devīm strī rūpam vā vicintayet
translated: Or one should remember the male form, or contemplate the female form of the Goddess.

analyzed: athavā niṣkalam dhyāyet saccidānanda vigraham
translated: Or else, one should meditate on the formless one, whose body is existence, consciousness, and bliss,

analyzed: sarva tejaḥ mayam divyam sa carācara vigraham
translated: Divine, full of all splendor, having the form of the moving and unmoving world.

analyzed: tatas sandarśayet mudrā daśakam parameśvarī
translated: Then, the Supreme Goddess should display the set of ten mudras.

original: yoniliṅgaṃ ca surabhiṃ heti mudrācatuṣṭayam //🔽p / vanamālāṃ mahāmudrāṃ nabhomudrāmapi kramāt /
analyzed: yoni liṅgam ca surabhim ha iti mudrā catuṣṭayam  vanamālām mahāmudrām nabhomudrām api kramāt
translated: The yoni, linga, and fragrant mudras, and the set of four heti mudras,🔽The garland of forest flowers, the great mudra, and also the sky mudra, in order.

original: yathāśaktijapet mūlamantraṃ śrīpādukāmapi //🔽hetimudrā kapālajñānatriśūlaṃ pustakamiti / iti mudrāḥ pradarśa prāsāda
analyzed: yathāśakti japet mūlamantram śrī pādukām api  heti mudrā kapāla jñāna triśūlam pustakam iti iti mudrāḥ pradarśa prāsāda
translated: One should recite the root mantra and the mantra of the Goddess's feet as much as one can.

original: parāparāprāsādātmakaṃ mūlamantraṃ śrīgurupādukāṃ ca yathā śaktijapitvā śirasi śrīguruṃ smaret
analyzed: parāparā prāsāda ātmakam mūlamantram śrī guru pādukām ca yathā śakti japitvā śirasi śrī gurum smaret
translated: The heti mudras are the skull, knowledge, trident, and book. Having displayed these mudras, one should recite the root mantra consisting of the higher and lower Praasaada, and the mantra of the feet of the revered Guru, as much as one can, and remember the revered Guru on the head.

analyzed: uktam ca tatra eva
translated: And it is said there itself:

original: mūrdhni saṃcintayed devī śrīguruṃ śivarūpiṇam /🔽sahasradalapaṅkaje sakalaśītaraśmiprabham //
analyzed: mūrdhni saṃcintayet devī śrī gurum śiva rūpiṇam  sahasra dala paṅkaje sakala śītaraśmi prabham
translated: On the head, one should contemplate the Goddess, the revered Guru, who is of the form of Shiva,🔽On a thousand-petaled lotus, having the luster of the full moon.

analyzed: vara abhaya kara ambujam vimala gandha puṣpa ambaram
translated: Having lotus hands in the gestures of boon and protection, wearing pure fragrant flowers,

analyzed: prasanna vadana īkṣaṇam sakala devatā rūpiṇam
translated: With a smiling face and eyes, having the form of all the deities.

analyzed: smaret śirasi tad abhidhāna pūrvam gurum
translated: One should remember the Guru at the head with that name.

original: iti dhyātvā praṇamya svagurukṛtasvanāma mūlādhāre smṛtvā śivarūpaṃ svātmānaṃ vicintayet /
analyzed: iti dhyātvā praṇamya sva guru kṛta sva nāma mūlādhāre smṛtvā śiva rūpam sva ātmānam vicintayet
translated: Thus meditating and bowing, remembering one's own name done by one's Guru at the base, one should contemplate oneself in the form of Shiva.

analyzed: evam nyāsa kartuḥ phalam āha
translated: Thus, the result of performing the Nyasa is stated:

original: p / evaṃ nyāse kṛte devī sākṣāt paraśivo bhavet /
analyzed: evam nyāse kṛte devī sākṣāt para śivaḥ bhavet
translated: Thus, when Nyasa is performed, the Goddess becomes directly the Supreme Shiva.

original: mantrī na cātra sandeho nigrahānugrahe kṣamaḥ //
analyzed: mantrī na ca atra sandehaḥ nigraha anugrahe kṣamaḥ
translated: The Mantra-reciting devotee becomes capable of bestowing grace and punishment, there is no doubt.

original: mahāṣoḍhāhvayaṃ nyāsaṃ yaḥ karoti hi pārvatī /
analyzed: mahā ṣoḍhā āhvayam nyāsam yaḥ karoti hi pārvatī
translated: O Parvati, he who performs the Nyasa called Maha-Shodhas

analyzed: divya kṣetram samuddiṣṭam samantāt daśa yojanam
translated: is declared to have a divine field extending ten Yojanas all around.

original: kṛtvā nyāsamimaṃ devī yatra gacchati mānavaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtvā nyāsam imam devī yatra gacchati mānavaḥ
translated: O Goddess, wherever a man goes after performing this Nyasa,

original: tatra syād dvijayo lābhaḥ sammānaṃ pauruṣaṃ priye //
analyzed: tatra syāt dvijayaḥ lābhaḥ sammānam pauruṣam priye
translated: there will be gain of Brahmins and honor from the people, O Beloved.

analyzed: mahā ṣoḍhā kṛta nyāsaḥ tat ajñam yadi bandate
translated: If one who has performed the Maha-Shodhas Nyasa praises an ignorant person,

analyzed: māsāt mṛtyum avāpnoti yadi trātā śiva svayam
translated: he will attain death within a month, unless Shiva Himself saves him.

analyzed: vajrapañjara nāmānam evam nyāsam karoti yaḥ  divi antarikṣa bhū śaila jala aranya nivāsinaḥ
translated: He who performs this Nyasa called Vajra-Panjara,🔽the dwellers of the divine, aerial, earthly, mountainous, watery, and forest regions,

analyzed: uddaṇḍa bhūta vetāla deva rakṣaḥ graha ādayaḥ
translated: the upraised ghosts, the divine Rakshasas, Grahas, and others,

original: bhayatrastena manasā nekṣante taṃ kuleśvarī //🔽mahāṣoḍhāhvayaṃ nyāsaṃ brahmaviṣṇuśivādayaḥ /
analyzed: bhaya trastena manasā na īkṣante tam kula īśvarī  mahā ṣoḍhā āhvayam nyāsam brahma viṣṇu śiva ādayaḥ
translated: With a mind frightened by fear, they do not look at her, O Mistress of the Kula.🔽The gods Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Śiva, and others,

analyzed: devāḥ sarve api kurvanti
translated: all the sages, yogis, and great sages, perform the mudrā called Mahāṣoḍhā.

original: p / bahunoktena kiṃ devī nyāsametat mama priyam /
analyzed: bahunā uktena kim devī nyāsam etat mama priyam
translated: O Goddess, what is the use of speaking much? This mudrā is dear to me.

analyzed: na a putrāya vadet devī na a śiṣyāya prakāśayet
translated: One should not tell it to one without a son, nor should one reveal it to a non-disciple.

analyzed: ājñā siddhim avāpnoti rahasi nyāsam ācaret
translated: One attains the perfection of the Command by practicing the mudrā in secret.

analyzed: asmāt paratarā rakṣā devatā bhāva siddhi dā
translated: This mudrā is the highest protection, the bestower of the perfection of the state of being a deity.

original: loke nāsti na sandeho satyaṃ satyaṃ varānane /
analyzed: loke nā asti na sandeho satyam satyam varānane
translated: There is no doubt about this in the world, O beautiful-faced one, it is true, it is true.

analyzed: ayam nyāsaḥ tu aneka janma arjita puṇyai prāpyate iti atas āha
translated: This mudrā is attained by the merits earned in many births. Therefore, it is said:

analyzed: praveśaḥ ca parā prāsāda cintanam
translated: The entry into the higher tradition, the contemplation of the supreme palace,

analyzed: mahā ṣoḍhā parijñānam na alpasya tapasaḥ phalam
translated: the perfect knowledge of Mahāṣoḍhā, is the fruit of no small austerity.

analyzed: dattvā anyaiḥ suhṛdbhiḥ saha svayam api bhuktvā sva ātmānam viśva atītam
translated: Having eaten oneself along with other well-wishers, contemplating one's own self as beyond the universe,

analyzed: bhāvayan yathā sukham viharet śivam
translated: One should enjoy as one pleases, in bliss. Peace.

analyzed: iti śrīmat cidānanda nātha viracitāyām svacchandapaddhatyām navama spandaḥ
translated: Thus ends the ninth pulsation in the Svacchandapaddhati composed by the illustrious Cidanan-danatha.
